怡人的,好脾气的,迷人的

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English  (in the sense 'pleasant, benign', applied to things): from late Latin amicabilis, from Latin amicus 'friend'

entry.def: When people have an amicable relationship, they are pleasant to each other and solve their problems without quarrelling.

example.ex: The meeting ended on reasonably amicable terms...
example.tran: 会议在较为友好的气氛中结束了。

example.ex: Our discussions were amicable and productive.
example.tran: 我们的讨论气氛非常友好并且富有成果。

means.word_mean: 1. characterized by friendship and good will

auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Kashmir dispute needs an urgent, amicable settlement.

stems_affixes.word_buile: ami=am爱,情爱+able能……的→能[被]爱的→亲切的
am爱,情爱+ic+able能……的→能爱[你]的→友好的
am爱,情爱+ity表名词,状态,性质→爱的状态→和睦
am爱,情爱+our表名词→n.奸情, 恋情
en进入+am爱,情爱+ity表名词→enmity爱太多的成为恨

sentences.en: The two nations settled their quarrel in an amicable way.
sentences.cn: 两国以和睦友好的方式解决了他们的争端。

sentences.en: The two nations reached an amicable agreement.
sentences.cn: 两国达成了一项友好协议。
